result.execSummary:
The defendant Isreal Rocha was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate w/o Valid License(2nd w/in3 Yrs), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.05(3)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine, costs and fees shall be paid at a rate of $30 per month commencing 9-01-15 and payable the first of each month until paid in full or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.
There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Documents verified with scanning; Paper file destroyed, retained electronically (scanned).

Def appeared in person.   Intern Samuel Tufford and Atty Mandy Schepper appeared for State.  Court has colloquy with Defendant regarding his right to counsel and accepts waiver.  Guilty plea entered.  Court finds def guilty and imposes a fine of $379 and $200 DNA surcharge to be paid at a rate of $30  per month commencing 9-01-15 or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.  There is a $15 administrative fee for any payment plan and any change to a payment plan. The fee will be added to the first payment. If not paid, a judgment shall be entered.  Court informs Defendant of DNA expungements rights.
Def appeared in person.  Intern Samuel Tufford and Atty Mandy Schepper appeared for State. Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.
